body: False positive, using the wrong URL.

This is an issue, the context name is not mandatory but the API client sends always something even if the context name is not provided (i.e. null), which ends up being used and validated, when the API request is processed in ZAP.
The API client needs to be changed to not send the optional parameters if not specified, the Spider API should be changed as well to ignore empty context names, since most of the API clients send the parameters with empty values.

rename.from: Regression in 2.4.3: Spider does not spider when called from API
rename.to: ZAP API clients should not send optional parameters unless specified

body: A new version (9) of the Java ZAP API Client has been released to address this issue.

issue.title: Change SpiderAPI to ignore empty context names when handling scan action

milestone.description: Enhancements and bug fixes expected to be included in the next main release.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change the method SpiderAPI.handleApiAction(String, JSONObject) to
ignore empty context names when handling the "scan" action since ZAP API
clients might always send the context's name parameter even if it was
not specified (for example, the ZAP API UI or older versions of Java ZAP
API client), leading to the "scan" action to always fail with missing
context error.
Related to #2108 - ZAP API clients should not send optional parameters
unless specified

issue.title: Change SpiderUrlTask to not send an empty context name

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
ZAP (v2.4.3) spider "scan" API enpoint validates the context name even
if it's empty, leading to the scan to always fail with missing context
error.
Bump version of Java API client.
Related to #2108 - ZAP API clients should not send optional parameters
unless specified
## 

Issue reported in OWASP ZAP User Group: https://groups.google.com/d/topic/zaproxy-users/1hzGyuJu-Fs/discussion

issue.title: Fix typo in PhpAPIGenerator, to use a property defined in class Zapv2

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Correct the name of a Zapv2 property ("base_other") used by the
generated API classes when calling OTHER endpoints.
Regenerate the PHP API client to fix the typo (and to not send the
parameters that were not specified, #2108).
Reported in #2168 - Problem with API on new ZAP 2.4.3

issue.title: docker API invocation  returns "code":"does_not_exist","message":"Does Not Exist"

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hi, 
I ran ZAP docker using the following command: 
docker run -p 8090:8090 -i owasp/zap2docker-stable zap.sh -daemon -port 8090 -config api.key=12345 -host 0.0.0.0

I tried running the following request:
http://0.0.0.0:8090/JSON/spider/action/scan/?zapapiformat=JSON&apikey=12345&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com&maxChildren=4&recurse=&contextName=default

But the output says:
"code":"does_not_exist","message":"Does Not Exist" 

The same output is returned for all the other api calls like ascan etc.

issue.title: Spider Failing with "Does Not Exist" Upon API Call Java api 2.4 v10.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hi,

I am using the stable docker container of owasp/zap2docker-stable to conduct spidering and attacking. Below I used bodgeit for the example.

Step 1: docker run --name "ZAP" -d -p 8090:8090 -i owasp/zap2docker-stable zap.sh -daemon -port 8090 -host 0.0.0.0 -config api.disablekey=true

Step 2: I use a java app using zap-api-2.4-v10.jar to automated this but I think it's easier to show on the ZAP docker container API UI.

By default the API sets the contextName parameter which can be left empty.  
The default request is not working containing contextName: 
http://<0.0.0.0>:8090/JSON/spider/action/scan/?zapapiformat=JSON&url=http%3A%2F%2F192.168.1.154%3A8080%2Fbodgeit%2F&maxChildren=&recurse=&contextName=

Returns: {"code":"does_not_exist","message":"Does Not Exist"}

What works (Removed contextName param): 
http://<0.0.0.0>:8090/JSON/spider/action/scan/?zapapiformat=JSON&url=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8080%2Fbodgeit%2F&maxChildren=&recurse=

Returns: {"scan":"0"}

body:
In 2017-10-02 (Weekly-Release) i faced the same Problem:
Always getting the ERROR-message that "Default Context" does not exist. It took me nearly 1 week to figure out what actually caused the error. 
First of all i tried to modify the Code, the most simple solution was just to comment out the try-catch-block inside the  includeInContext-Method, in the ZapHelper class. 
But i geuss it is not satisfying to modify a plugin yourself, so i was looking further into the  issue and figured out that actually the language Setup of ur PC caused the error. 
In my case (Germany) i could also set the 
private static final String ZAP_DEFAULT_CONTEXT_NAME = "Default Context"; to 
private static final String ZAP_DEFAULT_CONTEXT_NAME = "Standard-Kontext"; inside the ZapHelper class and it would fix the Problem ... but also switching ur PC to english would have the same result.

Dont wanna go to much into the Detail, but i geuss Zap takes your local language Settings and therefor 
the api-communication differs based on those Settings.

Short and simple Change the language on your Computer to english and it could solve your Problem, at least it did help me.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
